name: Encrypt Multiple Values
description: How to encrypt and send multiple values in a single transaction
longDescription: This example teaches efficient batch encryption in FHEVM. Instead of encrypting values separately, chain multiple .add*() calls to create a single encrypted input with shared proof. This reduces gas costs, ensures atomicity, and improves efficiency. Learn how to encrypt mixed types (integers + booleans) together and access them via handles array.

blocks.explanation: Store two encrypted values from a single encrypted input. Client uses .add64(a).add64(b).encrypt() and contract receives both via handles[0] and handles[1].
Store three encrypted values. Demonstrates scaling to more values with the same pattern. Order matters: first added = handles[0], second = handles[1], etc.
Store mixed encrypted types (euint64 + ebool) in single input. Shows that different types can share the same encrypted input and proof.
Store encrypted 3D coordinates. Practical example for games, location privacy, spatial data. Shows how to group related values.
Perform operations on multiple stored encrypted values. Examples: summing values, calculating distance squared, validating account with multiple conditions.
